project_abstract.cdata: The overall objectives of the Sulawesi Agricultural Area Development Project are to assist the government in reducing the incidence of poverty in the provinces of Central and Southeast Sulawesi through the increase of rural incomes, the promotion of equitable regional development, the promotion of environmentally sustainable farming practices, and the strengthening of local level institutions. The specific objectives of the project are to: 1) increase farmer productivity and incomes; 2) promote environmentally sustainable farming practices; and 3) improve the capacity of local institutions to identify, prepare, appraise and manage agricultural development programs. The project has three broad components: 1) agriculture-based area development, including a crop development program, livestock management and veterinary care, farm access roads, and community based initiatives; 2) project management and capacity strengthening of local agricultural support services comprising the rehabilitation and improvement of facilities, training, workshops, seminars, and technical assistance; and 3) farming systems and fisheries research support and technology transfer.
